alert.note: Alert for Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 05 at 3:01AM PST until March 05 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Light snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to an inch, locally up to 2 inches above 5000 feet including along Highways 44 and 36 west of Susanville. * WHERE...Surprise Valley California. * WHEN...Until 1 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Chain and snow tire requirements are likely this morning for roads west of Susanville, including Highways 44 and 36. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Check with CALTRANS for the latest road conditions before traveling.
info.instruction: Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
